verses.plain: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

tokens.t: Wine
a mocker, strong drink
raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

verses.plain: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

tokens.t: The fear of a king
as the roaring of a lion:
provoketh him to anger sinneth
his own soul.

verses.plain: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

tokens.t: an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

verses.plain: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.

tokens.t: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold;
shall he beg in harvest, and
nothing.

verses.plain: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

tokens.t: Counsel in the heart of man
deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

verses.plain: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

tokens.t: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

verses.plain: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

tokens.t: The just
walketh in his integrity: his children
blessed after him.

verses.plain: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

tokens.t: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

verses.plain: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

tokens.t: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

verses.plain: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.

tokens.t: Divers weights,
divers measures, both of them
alike abomination to the

verses.plain: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

tokens.t: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work
pure, and whether
right.

verses.plain: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.

tokens.t: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the
hath made even both of them.

verses.plain: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

tokens.t: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes,
thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

verses.plain: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

tokens.t: naught,
naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

verses.plain: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

tokens.t: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge
a precious jewel.

verses.plain: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

tokens.t: Take his garment that is surety
a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

verses.plain: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

tokens.t: Bread of deceit
sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

verses.plain: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

tokens.t: purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

verses.plain: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

tokens.t: He that goeth about
a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

verses.plain: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

tokens.t: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

verses.plain: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

tokens.t: An inheritance
gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

verses.plain: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.

tokens.t: Say not thou, I will recompense evil;
wait on the
, and he shall save thee.

verses.plain: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.

tokens.t: Divers weights
an abomination unto the
; and a false balance
not good.

verses.plain: Man’s goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?

tokens.t: Man’s goings
of the
; how can a man then understand his own way?

verses.plain: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

tokens.t: a snare to the man
devoureth
holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

verses.plain: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

tokens.t: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

verses.plain: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

tokens.t: The spirit of man
the candle of the
, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

verses.plain: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

tokens.t: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

verses.plain: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the gray head.

tokens.t: The glory of young men
their strength: and the beauty of old men
the gray head.

verses.plain: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.

tokens.t: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so
stripes the inward parts of the belly.

footnotes.text: Divers weights: Heb. A stone and a stone
divers measures: Heb. an ephah and an ephah
a false…: Heb. balance of deceit
cleanseth…: Heb. is a purging medicine against
